meanings.definition: A thing that is given free, often for promotional purposes.
meanings.sent1: The store had a giveaway of free samples to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: The company's giveaway of keychains was a hit at the trade show.
meanings.sent3: The giveaway of balloons made the event more festive.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a giveaway that she was excited about the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The bright sign outside was a giveaway that there was a sale.

meanings.sent1: His nervous laugh was a giveaway that he was hiding something.
meanings.sent2: The giveaway of his true feelings was evident in his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The giveaway of the surprise party was almost spoiled by a slip of the tongue.
meanings.sent4: The giveaway of the secret plan was a slip of the pen.
meanings.sent5: The giveaway of her excitement was hard to miss.

meanings.definition: A game or competition in which prizes are given away.
meanings.sent1: The school carnival had a giveaway where students could win prizes.
meanings.sent2: The radio station's giveaway of concert tickets drew in many listeners.
meanings.sent3: The giveaway at the fair had everyone trying their luck at winning a stuffed animal.
meanings.sent4: The giveaway of the grand prize caused a frenzy of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The giveaway of free trips was the highlight of the event.
